the symptoms you're experiencing can be signs of multiple conditions, not just stroke or tia. it's important to note that you're doing the right thing by performing the fast test, because it rules out the possibility of an acute stroke quite effectively. 

however, the intermittent tingling and numbness in your face, arm, and leg could be related to other neurological conditions like multiple sclerosis, migraines, or even some types of epilepsy. it can also be a sign of peripheral neuropathy which can be caused by a number of conditions, including vitamin deficiencies, diabetes, and more. the pressure in your head and dizziness could possibly be linked to migraines or other types of headaches, or conditions like meniere's disease. 

discuss these symptoms thoroughly with your neurologist. it might be useful to keep a symptom diary, noting the time, date, duration, and any relevant factors (like what you were doing or eating) when these episodes occur. this will help your doctor determine the best course of action. 

remember, early detection and treatment are the best ways to manage any neurological condition, so keeping up with your appointments, tests, and any prescribed therapies are essential. 

keep in mind this advice is intended to be general in nature, and specific causes may not apply to your situation. always consult with your healthcare provider about your symptoms.
